title: Robbery and theft out of motor vehicle on the rise
text:
Robbery and theft out of motor vehicle on the rise

There has been an increase in robberies and theft out of motor vehicle incidents in Goodwood.

According to police spokesperson Capt Wayne Theunis, the robberies mostly occur during the day with about two to four suspects who are involved in these incidents. “School children are often targeted and threatened with knives. It was also reported that some of the suspects operate using vehicles. Mostly cellphones and money are stolen.”

“We would like to encourage the public to refrain from walking alone and please avoid dark areas. Learners should also walk in groups,” says Theunis.

Robberies occur when cellphones are made visible, he explains.

“We urge the public to refrain from listening to music on their cellphones. Earphones indicate that people are in possession of cellphones.

“People should not create an opportunity to become victims of crime.”

Theunis says theft out of motor vehicles often happens when valuable items are left visible. “One modus operandi is where remote jamming is used to break into vehicles.

“Owners or drivers should ensure that their vehicle is locked when using a remote control.

“People are still leaving valuables like laptops, cameras and cash in their vehicles. This creates opportunities for thieves to break into their vehicles.

“We would also like to urge the community to report suspicious actions and people and to please write down registration numbers of vehicles that were involved in criminal activities,” he adds.
